original_solution_mapping.L1: There are 3 x 10 = <<3*10=30>>30 photos in total that can be placed in the first 10 pages.
original_solution_mapping.L2: There are 4 x 10 = <<4*10=40>>40 photos in total that can be placed in the next 10 pages.
original_solution_mapping.L3: A total of 10 + 10 = <<10+10=20>>20 pages of the album have been used.
original_solution_mapping.L4: A total of 30 + 40 = <<30+40=70>>70 photos can be placed on those 20 pages.
original_solution_mapping.L5: So there are still 100 - 70 = <<100-70=30>>30 photos left to be placed on the album.
original_solution_mapping.L6: And there are 30 - 20 = <<30-20=10>>10 pages left in the album.
original_solution_mapping.L7: Therefore, 30/10 = <<30/10=3>>3 photos can be placed on each of the pages.

original_function_code:
def solve():
    """Index: 2366.
    Returns: the number of photos that can be placed on each of the remaining pages.
    """
    # L1
    photos_per_page_first_section = 3 # 3 photos each on the first 10 pages
    pages_first_section = 10 # first 10 pages
    photos_first_section = photos_per_page_first_section * pages_first_section

    # L2
    photos_per_page_second_section = 4 # 4 photos each on the next 10 pages
    pages_second_section = 10 # next 10 pages
    photos_second_section = photos_per_page_second_section * pages_second_section

    # L3
    pages_used = pages_first_section + pages_second_section

    # L4
    photos_placed = photos_first_section + photos_second_section

    # L5
    total_photos = 100 # 100 photos on vacation
    photos_remaining = total_photos - photos_placed

    # L6
    total_pages = 30 # photo album with 30 pages
    pages_remaining = total_pages - pages_used

    # L7
    photos_per_remaining_page = photos_remaining / pages_remaining

    # FA
    answer = photos_per_remaining_page
    return answer

logical_steps.solution_line_template: There are {photos_per_page_first_section} x {pages_first_section} = <<{photos_per_page_first_section}*{pages_first_section}={photos_first_section}>>{photos_first_section} photos in total that can be placed in the first 10 pages.

There are {photos_per_page_second_section} x {pages_second_section} = <<{photos_per_page_second_section}*{pages_second_section}={photos_second_section}>>{photos_second_section} photos in total that can be placed in the next 10 pages.
A total of {pages_first_section} + {pages_second_section} = <<{pages_first_section}+{pages_second_section}={pages_used}>>{pages_used} pages of the album have been used.
A total of {photos_first_section} + {photos_second_section} = <<{photos_first_section}+{photos_second_section}={photos_placed}>>{photos_placed} photos can be placed on those {pages_used} pages.
So there are still {total_photos} - {photos_placed} = <<{total_photos}-{photos_placed}={photos_remaining}>>{photos_remaining} photos left to be placed on the album.
And there are {total_pages} - {pages_used} = <<{total_pages}-{pages_used}={pages_remaining}>>{pages_remaining} pages left in the album.
Therefore, {photos_remaining}/{pages_remaining} = <<{photos_remaining}/{pages_remaining}={photos_per_remaining_page}>>{photos_per_remaining_page} photos can be placed on each of the pages.
